Package com.betterfb

Class UserController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.betterfb.UserController
  • @Path("/auth")
public class UserController
extends Object
    Handles user authentication, including registration.

    • Method Detail

      • registerUser

        @POST
@Path("/register")
@Consumes("application/json")
@Produces("application/json")
public jakarta.ws.rs.core.Response registerUser​(User user)
        Registers a new user.
        Parameters:
        user - the user to register
        Returns:
        a response containing the registered user data or an error message

      • loginUser

        @POST
@Path("/login")
@Consumes("application/json")
@Produces("application/json")
public jakarta.ws.rs.core.Response loginUser​(UserLoginRequest request)
        Authenticates a user based on the provided login credentials. This method processes a login request by validating the supplied username and password. It checks for null values and responds with an appropriate error message if any are found. If valid credentials are provided, the method retrieves the user from the database using the username. If the user is not found or the password does not match, a 401 Unauthorized response is returned. Otherwise, an OK response is returned, indicating successful login.
        Parameters:
        request - the login request containing the username and password
        Returns:
        a Response indicating the outcome of the login attempt

      • requestPasswordReset

        @POST
@Path("/reset-password-request")
@Consumes("application/json")
@Produces("application/json")
public jakarta.ws.rs.core.Response requestPasswordReset​(Map<String,​String> requestBody)
        Requests a password reset for the user with the specified email address. This method processes a password reset request by retrieving the user from the database using the provided email address. If the user is not found, a 404 Not Found response is returned. Otherwise, a reset token is generated, stored in the database, and sent to the user via email. The method returns a successful response with a message indicating that the password reset email has been sent.
        Parameters:
        requestBody - a Map containing the email address of the user to request a password reset for
        Returns:
        a Response indicating the outcome of the password reset request

      • verifyResetToken

        @GET
@Path("/verify-reset-token")
@Produces("application/json")
public jakarta.ws.rs.core.Response verifyResetToken​(@QueryParam("token")
                                                    String token)
        Verifies a reset token and redirects to the reset password page if the token is valid and not expired.
        Parameters:
        token - the reset token to verify
        Returns:
        a 302 Found response with a location header pointing to the reset password page if the token is valid, a 401 Unauthorized response with a message indicating that the token is invalid or expired if the token is invalid or expired

      • resetPassword

        @POST
@Path("/reset-password")
@Consumes("application/json")
@Produces("application/json")
public jakarta.ws.rs.core.Response resetPassword​(Map<String,​String> requestBody)
        Resets the password of a user given a valid reset token and new password. This method processes a password reset request by retrieving the user from the database using the provided reset token. If the user is not found, a 404 Not Found response is returned. Otherwise, the method updates the user's password to the new password and resets the reset token and expiration date. If the reset token is invalid or expired, a 401 Unauthorized response is returned. If the user is found and the password is reset successfully, a 200 OK response is returned with a message indicating that the password was reset successfully.
        Parameters:
        requestBody - a Map containing the reset token and new password
        Returns:
        a Response indicating the outcome of the password reset request

      • getUserByLogin

        @POST
@Path("/user-info")
public jakarta.ws.rs.core.Response getUserByLogin​(User userRequest)
        Returns the user information for the user with the given username.
        Parameters:
        userRequest - a User object with the username to search for
        Returns:
        a Response with the user information if the user was found, or a 404 Not Found response if the user wasn't found

      • editUser

        @POST
@Path("/user-edit")
@Consumes("application/json")
@Produces("application/json")
public jakarta.ws.rs.core.Response editUser​(Map<String,​String> requestBody)
        Edits the user information for the user with the given userId. Requires the userId, username, name, surname and email to be provided in the request body. If any of the fields are not provided, they will not be updated.
        Parameters:
        requestBody - a Map containing the userId, username, name, surname and email to be updated
        Returns:
        a Response with the updated user information if the user was found, or a 404 Not Found response if the user wasn't found

      • searchUsers

        @GET
@Path("/search-users")
@Produces("application/json")
public jakarta.ws.rs.core.Response searchUsers​(@QueryParam("query")
                                               String query,
                                               @QueryParam("loggedInUserId")
                                               Long loggedInUserId)
        Searches for users which match the given search query in their username, name or surname. The search is case-insensitive and the search query is treated as a substring to be found. The user with the id given as the second parameter is excluded from the search results.
        Parameters:
        query - the search query to be searched for in the usernames, names and surnames of the users
        loggedInUserId - the id of the user which should be excluded from the search results
        Returns:
        a list of users which match the search query

      • sendFriendRequest

        @POST
@Path("/send-friend-request")
@Consumes("application/json")
@Produces("application/json")
public jakarta.ws.rs.core.Response sendFriendRequest​(Map<String,​Long> requestBody)
        Sends a friend request to the user with the given ID.
        Parameters:
        requestBody - a map containing the IDs of the sender and receiver
        Returns:
        a response indicating the outcome of the request

      • acceptFriendRequest

        @POST
@Path("/accept-friend-request")
@Consumes("application/json")
@Produces("application/json")
public jakarta.ws.rs.core.Response acceptFriendRequest​(Map<String,​Long> requestBody)
        Accepts a friend request with the given ID.
        Parameters:
        requestBody - a map containing the ID of the friend request to accept
        Returns:
        a response indicating the outcome of the request

@Path("/friends")

                                              Long userId)
        Gets a list of all friends of the user with the given ID.
        Parameters:
        userId - the ID of the user whose friends are to be retrieved
        Returns:
        a response containing a list of the user's friends
